documents.title: goodbye
text: that 's it from all of us here on the beds , herts and bucks live news feed .
we 'll be back on monday at 08:00 with more news , sport , travel and weather .

tonight we 'll be keeping our fingers crossed for milton keynes singer holly brewer , who 's hoping you 'll be `` making your mind up '' and voting for her to represent the uk in the eurovision song contest .
she 'll be performing `` i wish i love you more '' tonight live on you decide , on bbc two at 19:30 , where you can vote for your favourite singer .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: send your good luck messages to the chairboys
text: meanwhile , wycombe wanderers supporters are being encouraged to send good luck messages to the chairboys ahead of the fa cup tie against tottenham .
the club said twitter posts with # goodluckatthelane will be collated here and shown to the players before the game .
one more big day of build-up & then we 're there .
see your # goodluckatthelane messages appear here :

gutted i ca n't make it but confident the boys are capable of an upset !
# goodluckatthelane # believe
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: drinker loses appeal bid to overturn conviction for pub murder
text: a second attempt by a drinker to have a murder conviction overturned has failed at the court of appeal .
stuart james layden , 34 , from harlow in essex , was one of a gang who attacked ian church , 40 , outside the bricklayer 's arms in great yarmouth in may 2012 .
his conviction for a `` joint enterprise '' murder along with four others in 2013 , was quashed on appeal in 2015 .
a retrial at norwich crown court last year re-convicted him of the murder and he was again jailed for life .
today lord justice treacy , sitting at london 's criminal appeal court , heard him mount an attack on the jury 's guilty verdict and then dismissed his application for permission to appeal .
mr church was kicked and stamped upon after being knocked to the ground outside the pub and died of brain injuries .
lawyers for layden had argued that there remained a `` lurking doubt '' about his involvement in the attack .

dismissing the application , lord justice treacy said : `` it was for the jury to sift and analyse these shocking events , which happened at night over a short period of time - that is what juries do . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: wycombe wanderers prepare for spurs game
text: there is great interest in a possible fa cup giant killing on saturday and yesterday cameras were allowed into wycombe wanderers ' training session , ahead of their fourth round match against spurs on saturday .
they also caught the beast - aka adebayo akinfenwa - getting in some training in the gym .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy with patchy light rain
text: occasional clear spells overnight , but generally cloudy with outbreaks of mainly light and patchy rain in a moderate breeze across the bbc east region .
less cold tomorrow but expect a cloudy day with some further outbreaks of mainly light and patchy rain .
there 's a chance of sunshine in the west of the region before sundown .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f )
more details from bbc weather :
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: mystery after man found with head injuries in royston
text: police are trying to find out how a man ended up with serious head injuries in royston in the early hours of wednesday .
they say the 65-year-old man had been near morrisons and princes mews at about 00:40 .
he was taken to hospital , but has since been released .
police are keen to talk to anyone who saw anything , including two men who were in the area at the time .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: big garden birdwatch : 'charismatic migrants ' expected in uk gardens
text: as well as blue tits and house sparrows , unusual migrant birds could be spotted in our gardens during the rspb 's annual birdwatch .
more than half a million people are expected to take part in this year 's big garden birdwatch .
the bedfordshire-based rspb said people may be able to spot scandinavian visitors such as waxwings ( redwings and fieldfares .
the charity said the birds had left their homelands to feed on the uk 's bumper berry crop .

documents.title: watch the birdie !
text: for nearly 40 years now the bedfordshire-based rspb has been asking members of the public to take part in the big garden birdwatch , but this year it 's been extended by a day .
the charity is asking as many people as possible to log the birds that land in their garden in an hour and it can be completed on saturday , sunday or monday .
rupert masefield said the data was compiled to `` build a about how different birds are doing '' .
last year the most spotted bird in bedfordshire was the house sparrow , but in hertfordshire it was the blue tit .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: helen bailey : more photos released of cesspit under garage
text: the photos below have been released today by hertfordshire police .
they were shown at st albans crown court today when the jury heard how experts spent two days recovering helen bailey 's body from the cesspit in her garage .
the former well is where the 51-year-old 's body was found in july .
only ms bailey 's elbow was visible when police first looked inside the deep well , jurors at st albans crown court heard .
her fiance , ian stewart , 56 , denies murder , preventing a lawful burial , fraud and three counts of perverting the course of justice .
the case continues .

documents.title: helen bailey : photos shown to jury of crews accessing cesspit
text: a series of photos have been released by police which were shown to the st albans crown court jury in the trial over the death of helen bailey .
they were taken at the royston home the author shared with her partner ian stewart , who denies murder .
they show the process taken to recover the 51-year-old 's body found in the cesspit under their garage .

documents.title: author 's body took two days to recover
text: author 's body took two days to recover

documents.title: helen bailey : court hears her arsenal season tickets were renewed during her disappearance
text: the jury in the trial of ian stewart , accused of murdering his partner helen bailey , has heard how her two season tickets for arsenal football club were renewed more than a month after her death in april .
at the time police had been searching for the 51-year-old royston writer after she was reported missing by mr stewart , 56 .
the case at st albans crown court heard ms bailey was a keen arsenal supporter and a season ticket holder .
a statement by det con helen richmond was read out and she said she contacted the club as part of her investigations .
she said she was informed by the club that all the season ticket holder renewals had been sent out on 12 may last year .

ms richmond said she was then told that two season tickets held in ms bailey 's name had been renewed and paid for over the telephone on 16 may , using funds from ms bailey 's sole barclays bank account .
mr stewart , of baldock road , royston , denies murder , preventing a lawful burial , fraud and three counts of perverting the course of justice .
the trial continues .

documents.title: luton boss jones given touchline ban
text: luton boss jones given touchline ban

documents.title: weather : ice , ice baby
text: it was a cold and icy start to the day in milton keynes and hitchin , as these from bbc weather watcher , harry , show .
for the rest of the day it 's set to remain rather cloudy , with rain possible towards the evening .
temperatures will be much milder than yesterday though .
maximum temperature : 5c ( 41f ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: helen bailey : ian stewart paid for 'missing ' leaflets
text: the partner and alleged killer of helen bailey paid for flyers and attended a dog walk as part of the search effort for the missing children 's author , a court has heard .
in a statement read out at st albans crown court by the author 's friend , jay nolan-latchford , she said : `` when helen was missing i set up the 'where is helen bailey ? '
facebook page .
as part of our campaign we organised an awareness walk in royston .
it was during this walk i met ian stewart for the first time . ''
she added : `` ian insisted on paying for the leaflets we were going to distribute during the walk .
i was surprised when ian said he would come across to wave the group off - throughout the whole day i found ian to be unemotional and very contained in his manner . ''
ian stewart , 56 , of baldock road , royston , denies murder , preventing a lawful burial , fraud and three counts of perverting the course of justice .
the case continues .

documents.title: four people 'unhurt ' after mk bus fire
text: three passengers and a bus driver were `` safely removed '' from a number 4 arriva bus in milton keynes this morning after it caught fire .
the bus company confirmed there were `` no injuries '' on the service that runs between bletchley and milton keynes .
it said the `` driver safely secured the vehicle , ensuring no-one was injured and called the fire brigade who attended '' .
`` the vehicle has been taken back to milton keynes depot by recovery , '' a spokesman added .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tesco-booker deal 'not about job cuts '
text: the chief executives of tesco and booker both said on a call with reporters they plan to merge the two companies without cutting jobs .
they reckon they 'll get benefits of £ 25m and cost savings of £ 175m from combining the two companies .
but that would not be driven by a reduction in the number of roles , said dave lewis , head of welwyn-based tesco .
charles wilson , head of booker , which has about 800 workers at its wellingborough headquarters , said they hoped to `` keep the expertise '' in both firms .

documents.title: alfie barker admits fa charge over harry arter tweets
text: ex-hitchin town player alfie barker ( has admitted an fa charge related to tweets sent to bournemouth 's harry arter about the death of his baby daughter .

when bournemouth lost a three-goal lead to draw 3-3 with arsenal in the premier league on 3 january , barker posted on twitter : `` big hype just for a disappointment like the nine months leading up to your child 's birth . ''
he was charged with allegedly posting comments which were abusive and/or insulting and/or improper and/or brought the game into disrepute .

the 18-year-old , who takes medication to combat symptoms of adhd and a mild from of autism , later apologised for his `` disgraceful comments '' and said he would accept any punishment given to him .
a date for a hearing for barker , who was sacked , will be set in due course .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC Sport

documents.title: 'newsagents will see tesco-booker as a good deal '
text: booker is a major supplier to independent convenience stores across the uk .

its chief executive , charles wilson , was asked on a media call with reporters how shopkeepers might feel about buying their products from tesco - in many cases a direct rival - if the supermarket chain acquires booker .
`` it 'll take a bit of persuasion , '' he conceded .
however , corner shops face many other challenges including rising business rates and the living wage being implemented on staff , so they want to get the best out of their suppliers , he said .
`` in five years ' time i think they 'll be saying it 's a good deal for them , '' he added .
booker 's headquarters is on irthlingborough road in wellingborough and employs 800 people .

documents.title: borehamwood rent rise : 'suddenly you end up in the wilderness '
text: this is arif - he runs the tandoori restaurant in leeming road in borehamwood .
i spoke to him after the council announced his rent was set to increase by about £ 18,000 .
he said he 's been left `` devastated '' by the news .
the council says as it has n't put the rent up for 15 years it needs to rise , but it 's willing to negotiate with businesses .
hertsmere borough council are putting rents up in leeming road in borehamwood by as much as 400 % .
yes really .
lots are going out of business
what 's that all about ?
exactly what i 'm trying to find out .
it just does n't add up .
they will all go out of business .
it 's very very weird
my guess is they want to develop it but do n't want to buy them out or summink
one of the highest crime rates in herts - for violence , sexual assault and robbery .
my sis lived there briefly .

rows of empty shops will not help .

strange story
honestly i think it 's a prelude to knocking the area down and starting again less council properties and more private 1/2
dwellings .
demand for housing outstripping supply in b/wood .
area needs investment , almost a no-go at nights .

how the hell can they justify that price increase .
thats disgusting !
why are they increasing that much ?
author: Justin Dealey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: bus fire in mk : latest
text: we 're just getting more information about the bus fire in milton keynes this morning .
buckinghamshire and milton keynes fire service says it was called at just after 06:00 and found a bus `` severely damaged '' on the junction of springfield boulevard and marlborough street .
crews from broughton and great holm attended and used a main jet , one hose reel , two dry powder extinguishers and two sets of breathing apparatus .
police also attended and road closures were put in place until the vehicle was recovered .
the road has since re-opened .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: borehamwood businesses rent rise : 'it 's the first review in 15 years , ' council says
text: the council accused of putting up business rents in leeming road , borehamwood , by more than 400 % in some cases says it 's the `` first rent review for 15 years '' , and it 's trying to balance getting a good deal for taxpayers and keeping a thriving row of shops .

john graham , who 's in charge of finance at hertsmere borough council , said : `` we 've done an exercise in line with the institute of chartered surveyors and we 've worked out what we think is the market rent for each of those shops .
`` the last time one of those shops went up for rental at the market rent we had a competitive auction with four potential tenants .
`` i appreciate what 's happening with the tenants that are currently there , [ but ] there are historical reasons why those rentals on leeming road are low .
twenty years ago the eu gave a grant to the ward because of its social deprivation and at that time there were many empty shops in leeming road .

`` we 're seeking to find a balance between getting the right return for our ratepayers but keeping leeming road as a thriving parade - we need to find the balancing line that allows us to do that . ''
he added that rent negotiations will happen with leaseholders on a one-to-one basis when each lease comes up for renewal .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tesco 'confident ' on competition concerns
text: as well as its supplier business , booker also owns the londis , premier , family shopper and budgens convenience store brands , which have thousands of shops .
so , how will tesco satisfy potential concerns from uk competition regulators ?
tesco boss dave lewis said booker , based on irthlingborough road in wellingborough , does n't own the stores - they are run as franchises .
he also claimed a booker-tesco combination would n't have influence over key aspects of how the shops are run , including pricing .
`` we 're very confident that competition regulators will come to the same view , '' mr lewis said .

documents.title: what is booker ?
text: chances are you 've bought food from booker in the uk , even if you were n't aware of it .
it 's the uk 's largest cash and carry operator , selling everything from baked beans to teabags to 700,000 small businesses .
it employs about 800 people at its wellingborough headquarters .
a whole range of well-known restaurant chains , such as wagamama , prezzo and byron burger , use food supplied by booker .
and on the high street , it owns the premier , budgens and londis convenience-store brands .
in total , profits for the group were £ 127.8m in the year ending on 27 march .

documents.title: travel : bus on fire causes delays in mk
text: there 's slow traffic due to an earlier bus on fire on b4034 marlborough street between childs way ( springfield roundabout ) and chaffron way in milton keynes .
all lanes have been re-opened .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: tesco agrees to buy booker in £ 3.7bn deal
text: the uk 's biggest supermarket group tesco , based in hertfordshire , has agreed to buy northamptonshire company booker group in a £ 3.7bn deal .
the firms said the deal would create the `` uk 's leading food business '' .

booker group , whose headquarters is in wellingborough , is the uk 's largest cash and carry operator , supplying everything from baked beans to teabags to 700,000 convenience stores , grocers , pubs and restaurants .
booker also owns the premier , budgens and londis convenience-store brands .

documents.title: messi 's body double & fame in singapore
text: messi 's body double & fame in singapore
author: Phil Shepka
BBC Sport

documents.title: borehamwood businesses claim rent has gone up by more than 400 %
text: businesses in borehamwood operating from buildings owned by the local council say they are being forced to move out as they can no longer afford to pay the rent - which in some cases has gone up by more than 400 % .
david bowman , from deadline reprographics , said his rent of £ 6,000 per annum was put up to £ 28,000 , with no warning .
`` we were told it was going to go up 3 % like inflation , '' he said , adding he has `` no choice '' but to close his business .
another business owner , who has run the borehamwood tandoori for 28 years , said his rent was £ 10,000 per annum and it has also been put up to £ 28,000 .
hertsmere borough council said it 's the first rent review for 15 years and it 's worked out what it thinks the market rate is .
we 'll bring you more from the authority shortly .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fa cup : wycombe aim to extend unbeaten run at spurs
text: wycombe wanderers travel to white hart lane on saturday to play tottenham in the fa cup .
manager gareth ainsworth said his side are aiming to extend their 16-match unbeaten run .
`` it will be a brilliant day for wycombe wanderers , one that will live in the memory , but we want to go there and give a good account of ourselves , '' he said .
`` we 've got this run going , 16 unbeaten is fantastic .
the boys have been unbelievable , they 've pulled up trees for me and they deserve a good shot at this game . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: friday 's weather : mainly grey and cloudy , not quite as chilly as yesterday
text: we are starting off this morning with another widespread frost and we 've got a few early outbreaks of rain too so some of this rain will refreeze onto the roads and pavements - there 's a met office warning of ice for the rest of the morning .
through the afternoon it 's going to stay rather grey and cloudy , and with a slight shift of wind direction , temperatures will get up to between 3c and 5c ( 37f to 41f ) .
watch my full regional forecast here :

BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to the live page for beds , herts and bucks where we 'll bring you the latest news , sport , travel and weather until 18:00 .
the trial of ian stewart , the man accused of murdering his partner helen bailey , resumes today - after not sitting on thursday .
we 'll bring you all the news from the court as we get it .
plus , we 'll be looking ahead to wycombe wanderers fourth round fa cup tie with tottenham hotspur - can the league two chairboys cause an upset against premier league opposition ?
manager gareth ainsworth certainly looks like he means business as he posed at yesterday 's press call .

it 's still a bit parky outside but i have it on good authority that it 's due to get milder over the weekend- we 'll have a full regional weather forecast shortly so you can see what the day is due to bring .
meanwhile , remember , you can contact us at any time via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: saima khan death : sister sabah khan to stand trial in june
text: the trial of a woman accused of murdering her sister in luton will take place at the old bailey in june .
at luton crown court in september , sabah khan , 26 , of overstone road , luton denied killing her sister saima khan , 34 , ( who was stabbed to death in may 2016 .
the trial , which was due to take place in february , has been postponed while psychiatric reports are prepared .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woodhill prison records highest number of suicides in england and wales
text: a record number of people killed themselves in prisons in england and wales in 2016 , figures show .
the ministry of justice said there were 119 self-inflicted deaths - 29 more than the previous year and the highest number since records began in 1978 .
woodhill prison , near milton keynes , recorded the highest number of inmate deaths , with seven people taking their own life in the 12 months to september 2016 .
there were also four self-inflicted deaths at bedford prison .
justice secretary liz truss said the figures were `` very serious '' , but she was dealing with the problem .
she said the government was investing an extra £ 100m into the prisons estate , as well as hiring 2,500 more officers .

documents.title: tim peake opens new education centre in stevenage
text: british astronaut tim peake has just opened a new science and technology centre at airbus in stevenage .
look !
@ twitterid opening the new airbus discovery space !
check our website for more info .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coventry draw wycombe in efl trophy semi
text: coventry draw wycombe in efl trophy semi

documents.title: union warns of 'dangerous rise ' in ambulance waiting times
text: the gmb union , which represents nhs workers , is warning of the dangerous rise in ambulance waiting times for patients in the three counties .
almost 30 % of the most seriously ill patients in the east of england were not seen within the eight minute target last year .
the figures from the national audit office come as the east of england ambulance service reports its busiest ever winter .
the service has revealed that in one day alone it treated more than 4,000 people .

robert morton , the chief executive of the east of england ambulance service , said : `` clearly we would want more money and we want it now - but i think importantly what we also need is continuing recognition of the pressure we are all under . ''
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: babestation call mix-up 'will be resolved '
text: earlier this week you may have seen a bbc news story about residents of an irish town being plagued by callers trying to reach x-rated tv channel babestation , which is based in milton keynes .
people in westport , county mayo , were up in arms over late-night landline calls intended for the channel .
the mix-up was a result of irish viewers calling the show 's premium-rate numbers , which start with 098 , without adding the international dialling code .
the matter had been referred to authorities , including the broadcasting authority of ireland ( bai ) and comreg , the republic of ireland 's communications sector regulator .
this morning , the executive manager of babestation has told us that a solution had been found .
`` on the screen there is a dedicated number for people in ireland to call but it 's small on the graphic and you can see where the confusion is , '' he said .

`` we found a resolution late last night and hopefully , fingers crossed , by this evening , or at the latest tomorrow evening , we 'll have a new range of numbers which are n't 0982 numbers and are 0908 numbers . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pilot killed in aston rowant nature reserve crash named
text: a pilot killed when his light aircraft crashed in oxfordshire was a parish councillor from milton keynes .
david norris , 64 , died at the scene when his plane crashed at aston rowant nature reserve on 15 january .
he had flown from turweston aerodrome in north buckinghamshire .

mr norris was the chairman of newton longville parish council , and in a message posted on the newton longville village website , his wife sylvie thanked friends and villagers for their `` support and kind words '' .
`` the shock has been beyond words but with so many folk rallying to keep me going i will fight on , '' she said .
an inquest into his death will be held on 1 february .
the air accidents investigation branch said it was investigating the incident .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: child gene study identifies new developmental disorders
text: two girls from the three counties have been identified as having a rare genetic disorder , which so far has only been spotted in 11 children in the uk .
caitlyn hunter , 9 , from luton and tamika kyd , 10 , from hatfield , both have a faulty cdk13 gene which affects their learning and communication .
it was discovered as part of a major genetic study , which identified 14 new childhood developmental disorders .
scientists sequenced the genes of thousands of children from across the uk and ireland with rare , undiagnosed conditions .
the research , in the journal nature , was co-ordinated by the wellcome trust sanger institute near cambridge .
matthew hurles , who led the study , said it `` ended the odyssey for parents who 'd spent years trying to find the cause of their child 's condition '' .
author: Fergus Walsh
Medical correspondent

documents.title: bake off winner candice brown at the ntas
text: if you watched last night 's televised national television awards you probably saw a familiar local face amongst the plethora of tv stars .

as the cameras panned to great british bake off judge mary berry , next to her was the rather glamorous looking winner of the series , barton-le-clay 's candice brown , who last year was either watching the awards ceremony from home or practising fondant fancies in her kitchen .
it seems that she is still getting used to her new celebrity status , as on the way to the ceremony yesterday she tweeted that she was `` still pinching myself '' at the fact she was going .
and the icing on the proverbial cake - mary berry won the award for best judge , beating simon cowell , david walliams and nicole scherzinger .

documents.title: tim peake due to open science centre in stevenage
text: tim peake is visiting airbus in stevenage today to open a new science and technology centre , which has been built around the area being used to test the mars rover .
last year , major tim remotely controlled the rover during his 186-day stay on the international space station .
it is is due to be sent to mars in 2020 .
funded by airbus , the centre will run in partnership with north hertfordshire college to encourage youngsters into the engineering industry .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: today 's weather : cloudy with a cold wind
text: today is due to feel like it 's the coldest day of the year so far .
we seem to have lost the fogginess but there 'll be plenty of low grey cloud and a chilly , brisk south-easterly wind which will make it feel colder .
maximum temperature : 1c ( 33f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to the live page for beds , herts and bucks where we 'll bring you the latest news , sport , travel and weather until 18:00 .
this morning , astronaut tim peake is due to visit airbus in stevenage .
last year , he remotely controlled their mars rover when he was in the international space station so we 're expecting he 'll be taking a closer look today .
there 's also the draw for the semi-finals of the football league trophy to look forward to - featuring wycombe wanderers and luton town .

the fog seems to have cleared from most places this morning but it 's still a bit brass monkeys out there - we 'll have a full regional weather forecast shortly so you can see what the day is due to bring .
meanwhile , remember , you can contact us at any time via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: officers dismissed for gross misconduct
text: officers dismissed for gross misconduct

documents.title: ambulance trust running 'at deficit '
text: ambulance trust running 'at deficit '

documents.title: that 's it for today
text: live updates have now finished for the day .
we 'll return from 08:00 tomorrow .
scroll back through today 's feed for anything you may have missed , including the latest on the helen bailey murder investigation .
stay tuned to this page overnight for any breaking news from around beds , herts and bucks .
have a great evening .

documents.title: police commissioner condemns 'abhorrent incident ' as officers dismissed
text: reacting to the decision to dismiss four bedfordshire police officers , police and crime commissioner kathryn holloway said : `` my overwhelming concern and that of the chief constable was the distress this whole abhorrent incident inevitably created for the victim .
`` i hold bedfordshire police and chief constable jon boutcher to account and there is absolutely no room whatsoever in this force for any officer who shows disrespect to any victim .
`` in my view , instant dismissal for gross misconduct was the only possible appropriate outcome for the officers involved . ''
mr boutcher added : `` i have apologised to this remarkable and brave young lady and have continued to support her throughout the investigation .

`` victims should be at the heart of everything we do at bedfordshire police and we will not tolerate any attitude which undermines those values or damages the trust and confidence of those affected by crime . ''

documents.title: four police officers dismissed for showing 'disrespect ' to victim
text: four bedfordshire police officers have been dismissed after a hearing found they had committed gross misconduct by showing `` disrespect '' to a young female crime victim .
pcs robin denton , matthew neild , todd mills and deanna waite were found to have `` discussed a sensitive allegation '' in terms that amounted to a breach of standards of professional behaviour .
pc neild was also found to have breached the standard of professional behaviour concerning confidentiality .
the breaches were upheld yesterday following a two-day hearing in newport pagnell .
chief constable jon boutcher said further details regarding their wrongdoing were restricted because of an ongoing legal case .

documents.title: getting handy with the 3d printer
text: can you guess what this is ?
top marks and a pat on the back if you guessed it 's a 3d-printed hand .
a very small one , for a very small boy who was born without most of the fingers on his right hand .
five-year-old donaghan hazlewood , from bedford , was born with poland syndrome which affects about one in 100,000 babies .
it 's the second time scientists at the university of bedfordshire have created a hand for a child .
although donaghan has a partial thumb and little finger , his new state-of-the-art plastic appendage `` will make him feel like he can do anything he wants to '' , mum alicia frith said .
`` he 's very excited about his hand , he 's told all his friends and teachers at school about it .
he calls it his iron man hand . ''
dad rory hazlewood added : `` we have always encouraged donaghan to do things for himself , but there are some things he ca n't do , like use a knife and fork .
`` he wants to go out on his bike but he ca n't use the brakes and it makes him feel unstable .
the hand will make him feel like everyone else . ''
today donaghan had his first fitting and got a feel for his new hand .
scientists are busy making adjustments and hope they 'll see him again in a couple of weeks .
we 'll bring you more on this when we know donaghan 's been able to take his `` iron man hand '' home for good .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: weather : cloudy with frost and icy patches for some
text: staying cloudy and misty with some spots of drizzle or a few snow flakes , which could lead to icy patches on untreated surfaces .
temperatures could get as low as -2c ( 28f ) in frost-prone spots .
a cold start to the day tomorrow , although rather cloudy at first with some light snow flurries or spots of drizzle possible .
highs of 1-3c ( 34f-37f ) .
weather has more details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: daughter of helen bailey 's first husband says author 'did n't reply to text '
text: the daughter of helen bailey 's first husband , john sinfield , gave evidence to the jury this afternoon and told how the author had made her father happy .
jenny winterbottom said ms bailey was 11 years older than her .
she said after her father died in 2011 in a drowning accident on holiday in barbados , she stayed in contact with the royston author .

the daughter told st albans crown court they would always let each other know when they were off on holiday or had returned , and she said on 14 april last year she sent ms bailey a text to say she had returned from a holiday .
ms winterbottom said she found it `` unusual '' that she did n't get a reply .
the jury has been told by the prosecution that helen bailey was murdered by her partner ian stewart on monday , 11 april last year .
he denies the charge .
case proceeding .

documents.title: luton and bedford in top 10 of rough sleepers
text: luton and bedford were among the top 10 local authorities with the highest numbers of people sleeping rough in a snapshot taken on a single night .

figures from the department for communities and local government , released this morning , show more than 4,000 people a night have been sleeping rough on england 's streets , a 16 % increase on last year .
the homelessness charity crisis said it was rising at an `` appalling rate '' .
the government said it was determined to help the most vulnerable and was investing £ 550m to tackle the problem .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: murder accused 'considered cliff jump '
text: murder accused 'considered cliff jump '

documents.title: helen bailey murder trial : partner tells arresting officers 'you 're joking '
text: the moment a half-dressed ian stewart was arrested in an early-morning swoop on his royston home has been played at his trial for murder at st albans crown court .
mr stewart is accused of killing his partner helen bailey and hiding her body in a cesspit underneath the garage .
the footage , captured by a police bodycam shortly after 07:00 on 11 july , showed a group of officers waiting for mr stewart at the foot of his stairs .
after being told of the accusations against him , mr stewart , now sitting at the bottom of the stairwell , asked : `` where is she ?
i do n't know why the garage is open . ''
mr stewart also told his arresting officers , `` you 're joking '' and when they asked him if he understood what was happening , he said `` i guess so '' .
he then added : `` bloody hell , why ? ''
and `` i do n't understand ?
what ? ''
before leaving , he told police : `` just tell jamie to shut the garage , it should n't be open . ''
ms bailey 's body was found four days later , alongside her dachshund boris .
mr stewart denies murder , preventing a lawful burial , fraud and three counts of perverting the course of justice .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rough sleeping rises at 'appalling rate '
text: rough sleeping rises at 'appalling rate '

documents.title: watford sign argentine forward zarate
text: watford sign argentine forward zarate

documents.title: helen bailey murder trial : partner claims he came 'very close ' to killing himself
text: the trial was told ian stewart confided in a psychiatric nurse that he had come `` very close '' to killing himself .
st albans crown court heard he claimed on the day of helen bailey 's disappearance in april he found a note from her saying she had gone to her cottage in broadstairs , kent .
the jury heard he told mental health worker sarah tooley that on visiting the property himself , he considered throwing himself off the cliffs there .
she had been speaking to him by phone in may after he referred himself to mental health services over concerns about his state of mind .

ms tooley said : `` he was reflecting on his time in broadstairs and stated he had come very close to killing himself while he was there , but his father had been very supportive and he was back tidying up personal affairs and feeling better with himself . ''
the jury previously heard that in june of last year , mr stewart went to spain for a pre-booked holiday and , on his return , told the nurse he was happy to be `` discharged '' .
mr stewart , 56 , of baldock road , royston , denies murder and five other charges related to ms bailey 's death .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: helen bailey murder trial : accused reluctant to forfeit phone
text: the jury in the trial of ian stewart , who denies murdering his partner helen bailey , has been told he was reluctant to forfeit his phone to police , before claiming he had lost it .
st albans crown court heard the phone was examined in april but the defendant was later asked if officers could take it away again .
prosecutor stuart trimmer said : `` he aired concerns about handing over his phone , saying this was his lifeline to helenand the mental health support team he was in the care of . ''
in a statement , det con hollie daines said she asked again for the device by email in june 2016 while mr stewart was on holiday in spain .
he replied two days later that he had misplaced it while transferring to another phone .
the officer confirmed the police never got hold of the phone .
more follows
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: helen bailey murder trial : 'you wo n't find anything in the garage ' , partner says
text: the man on trial for murdering children 's author helen bailey told police they would not `` find anything '' in the garage where her body was eventually discovered , a court has heard .
ian stewart , 56 , is accused of drugging and killing the writer at their royston house last april and hiding her body in a cesspit underneath the garage .
the jury at st albans crown court heard he told officers they were better probing the house itself .

according to a statement from det con hollie daines , read to the court by prosecutor stuart trimmer , mr stewart said : `` if searches are going to take place , you would n't find anything in the garage . ''
referring to the fact that officers wanted to search for electronic devices and sim cards , he said : `` if anything , the devices will be in the house . ''
mr stewart also suggested he did not `` want to be '' with his missing bride-to-be if she was to return , the court was told .
the jury heard the defendant refused to consent to a full search that day , but took officers around specific locations - including the garage .
ian stewart denies charges of murder , preventing a lawful burial , fraud and three counts of perverting the course of justice .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: kelvin hopkins : 'labour 's got to step up to the plate '
text: meanwhile , the labour mp for luton south , kelvin hopkins , who supported the leave campaign , said his party should not seek to use yesterday 's ruling that theresa may must consult parliament before triggering article 50 to obstruct the government .
`` the reality is we 're going to vote by a substantial majority in the house of commons for article 50 , '' he said .
`` we 've got two by-elections coming in copeland and stoke central - both voted very strongly for leave .
`` i think labour 's got to step up to the plate and say we support that decision and we 're going to get on with life after brexit . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: brexit white paper 'not a delaying tactic '
text: as theresa may announces that the government will set out its brexit plans in a formal policy document - known as a white paper - we know at least one bedfordshire mp will be right behind it .
it follows yesterday 's supreme court ruling that theresa may must consult parliament before triggering article 50 - the formal process for leaving the european union .
a white paper is a document which sets out proposals for a future act of parliament , which provides a basis for further consultation and discussion .
the conservative mp for north east bedfordshire , alistair burt , is a member of the select committee on exiting the eu and told the bbc this morning the paper was not a delaying tactic .
`` the all-party brexit select committee , which includes those who voted to leave the european union , unanimously said to the government that it should publish a white paper , '' he said .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mk50 : prime minister says town 'will have a great future '
text: milton keynes 50th birthday was mentioned in the house of commons this lunchtime , bringing cheers from the mps assembled for prime minister 's questions .

the subject was brought up by milton keynes south mp , iain stewart , who asked prime minister theresa may if she would agree that `` milton keynes has a great future and will be central to this government 's ambitions '' ?
`` we have been the most successful of new cities and have one of the highest rates of economic growth , '' he said .
mrs may responded by saying milton keynes was a `` great example of what you can achieve with a clear plan and strong local leadership '' .
`` milton keynes has not just had a great 50 years but i 'm sure [ it ] will have a great future as well , '' she said .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football league trophy draw confirmed for thursday
text: the draw for the semi-finals of the checkatrade trophy , which will include wycombe wanderers and luton town , will take place at 11:30 on thursday .
the news appeared on the checkatrade trophy twitter feed ( try saying that out loud ! )
wycombe booked their place with last night 's 2-1 win at mansfield .
coventry city are also through after beating swansea 's under-21s 4-2 on penalties after a 1-1 draw .
the other teams joining them in the draw are luton and yeovil , whose quarter-final was postponed yesterday and is now due to be played on 7 february .
oxford united and bradford city will also be in the hat after their game was postponed 20 minutes before kick-off because of a frozen pitch .

author: Katy Lewis

documents.title: helen bailey murder trial : partner 'would not consent to full house search '
text: i 'm at st albans crown court this morning for the ongoing trial of ian stewart , the partner of writer helen bailey , who denies murdering her and hiding her body in a cesspit underneath the garage of their royston home .

this morning we 've heard from det con hollie daines , who in a statement read out by the prosecution told the court mr stewart would not consent to a full search of the house and said they would n't find anything in the garage .
we 've also been told by a psychiatric nurse that mr stewart said he wanted to end his life in may 2016 and that his behaviour was `` changeable '' .
ian stewart denies murder along with five other charges - preventing a lawful burial , fraud and three counts of perverting the course of justice .
author: Mike Cartwright
BBC Look East

documents.title: cause of fatal fire engine crash still not known
text: police say they still do n't know what caused a fire engine to overturn and kill a pedestrian in royston .
mitchell bailey , 58 , from the town , died at about 20:45 on 18 january when he was hit by a hertfordshire fire engine responding to a call .
it was travelling along old north road and was making a right hand turn into burns road when , for reasons unknown at this stage , it lost control on a roundabout and overturned .
sgt richard cruse said the force 's investigation into what caused the crash is continuing .
`` i am appealing for anyone who witnessed the incident , or who saw the fire engine prior to the collision and has n't already spoken to police , to please get in touch , '' he said .
`` our thoughts remain with the man 's family and friends at this very difficult time . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: badminton england 'may have to scale down ' milton keynes hq
text: milton keynes-based badminton england has warned it could be forced to scale down its operation in the town if it loses nearly £ 6m in funding .
it 's launching a campaign to fight the proposed cuts from uk sport .
last month , uk sport announced it was taking away all its investment from badminton 's olympic programme .
an appeal will be heard next month , but chief executive adrian christy says it would affect the loughton-based headquarters .

`` we have a fantastic environment in milton keynes , we have a very , very focussed group of players , coaches and support staff and that 's essentially what the funding gets invested in , '' he said .
`` if we lose the money it means that certainly the number of players and the number of coaches that we have around the centre would be definitely scaled down . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fourth charge over 'car park murder '
text: fourth charge over 'car park murder '

documents.title: breakingfourth man charged in great linford car park murder case
text: a fourth person has been charged with murder after the body of a canadian man was found in a milton keynes car park at the weekend .

prashanth thevarasa , 23 , of farrier place , downs barn , milton keynes , has been charged with killing suren sivananthan , 32 , who was found dead near the co-op in st leger drive , great linford , at 04:00 on saturday .
two other men from milton keynes and a 17-year-old boy from london have also been charged with murder .
mr thevarasa will appear at milton keynes magistrates ' court later .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fly-tipping investigation under way
text: an investigation is under way to find out why a pile of fly-tipped rubbish was n't cleared from a bedfordshire lane for three days .
on monday we told you a cyclist sent us of a large quantity of waste dumped along london lane in houghton conquest on saturday - including a toilet , bathtub and fridge .
the rubbish was finally removed on tuesday morning .
budge wells , deputy executive member for community services at central bedfordshire council , said he wants to know why it took so long .
`` i 've instigated an inquest if you like , into exactly what happened and why information was n't passed to the proper departments , '' he said .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: vicarage road turf lights give watford orange glow
text: meanwhile , if anyone in watford was confused by it looking almost daylight in the early hours of this morning , bbc weather supremo kate kinsella can confirm it was n't a ufo .
she tweeted it was the `` turf lights '' at vicarage road that they put on to protect the pitch ( not the floodlights ) which combined with the fog to give off an orange glow .
the fog in # watford combined with the @ twitterid turf lights = daylight across west watford !
not an approaching ufo as many suggest !
it 's really bloody antisocial !
grr .
i am blaming it for theo being up so early
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wycombe wanderers trophy success payout
text: for anybody who mocks the football league trophy - this season known as the checkatrade trophy - and questions their team 's participation , then look to wycombe wanderers who have pointed out that if you go far in the competition you can be a financial winner .
following their win at mansfield last night , a victory which sent them into the semi-finals , the club tweeted they have so far `` banked £ 130,000 in prize money '' from the competition .
and do n't forget , this saturday they face tottenham in the fourth round of the fa cup .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wycombe goalscorers tweet their delight
text: last night 's goalscorers have tweeted their delight at getting through to the semi-finals of the checkatrade trophy - making them just one win away from a wembley final .
the win also marked a run of 16 games unbeaten .
adebayo akinfenwa - otherwise known as the beast - who scored the winner in the last 10 minutes said the `` effort and team spirit we have is a beautiful thing '' .
scott kashket paid tribute to the fans - calling them `` brilliant '' .

documents.title: wycombe wanderers : one game from wembley
text: wycombe wanderers are through to the semi-finals of the football league trophy - one game from wembley - after coming from behind to win 2-1 at mansfield .
matt green 's penalty gave the stags a half-time lead , but scott kashket and adebayo akinfenwa struck in the last 10 minutes to send the chairboys through .
manager gareth ainsworth said : `` it 's great that i can say one game from wembley , we may not get there but we 'll give it a right go , believe me . ''
ft : mansfield 1-2 wycombe .

documents.title: duke of cambridge called to injured man
text: earlier we brought you news that prince william was part of the air ambulance team that landed at an incident in kempston , just outside bedford this morning .
we 've since spoken to the ambulance service , which told us the duke of cambridge was called to help a man in his 50s with a leg injury sustained in an `` industrial accident '' .
it happened at about 08:30 on the woburn road industrial estate .
the man was conscious and breathing and flown to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge to receive treatment .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pe teacher banned for sex with boy , 15
text: pe teacher banned for sex with boy , 15

documents.title: breakingluton buried body case : jury discharged
text: a man accused of keeping the murder of his sister-in-law a secret for 12 years could face a retrial after a jury at luton crown court could not agree on a series of charges .
the charges relate to the discovery of natalia wilkanowska 's body , which was buried under rubble in a garden in luton .
the 50-year-old ( above ) disappeared in 2003 after visiting her ex-husband , gerald doherty , in luton .
her body was found in 2015 at a house on icknield way ( below ) .

joseph doherty , 73 , from old greenock road , port glasgow , scotland , denied one charge of perverting the course of justice , one of obstructing the coroner by giving a false account of ms wilkanowska 's death and one charge of preventing her lawful burial .
judge michael kay qc discharged the jury today .
prosecutor neil king said it was likely the prosecution would be seeking a retrial .
the case will be mentioned again in court on 3 february .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: luton v yeovil postponed due to frozen pitch
text: tonight 's checkatrade trophy quarter-final match between luton and yeovil has been postponed due to a frozen pitch at kenilworth road .
it 's been rearranged for next month
yeovil match off : frozen pitch means tonight 's game is postponed .
new date is tuesday 7th february , 7.45pm ko # coyh

documents.title: former mercedes team boss ross brawn returns to f1 management
text: ross brawn , the former boss at brackley-based mercedes , has been appointed to lead the sporting and technical side of formula 1 as us giant liberty media completed its $ 8bn ( £ 6.4bn ) takeover of the sport .
the takeover has also seen bernie ecclestone removed from his role as chief executive after nearly 40 years in charge of the sport .
after 15 years working with michael schumacher at benetton and ferrari , he then moved in 2007 to honda f1 , based in brackley .
brawn , 62 , then bought the team , renaming it brawn gp , and winning the world championship with jenson button in 2009 .
mercedes bought the team in 2009 and brawn left in 2013 , announcing his retirement from the sport .
however , he had been acting as a consultant to liberty during their takeover .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: men and boy charged over car park murder
text: men and boy charged over car park murder

documents.title: weather watchers : your photos
text: after a foggy start this morning we 've now received some well-deserved sunshine - and of course , our bbc weather watchers have been snapping away and sending us their lovely photos .
here 's just a few of our top
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: breakingbody in milton keynes car park : three charged with murder
text: police in milton keynes have charged three people , including a 17-year-old boy , with murder after a man 's body was discovered in a car park in great linford in the early hours of saturday .
the dead man has been named as 32-year-old suren sivananthan from canada .
gnanachandran balachandran , 37 , of the fleet , springfield , milton keynes , has been charged with one count of murder .
kiroraj yogarajah , 30 , of dunthorne way , grange farm , milton keynes , has also been charged with murder , along with a 17-year-old boy from croydon .
all three are due to appear before magistrates in milton keynes later .
a 23-year-old man , arrested on sus of murder yesterday , remains in police custody .
thames valley police says its response to the incident has been referred to the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: luton schools 'set to lose £ 22m a year '
text: teaching unions are warning that school budgets are close to breaking point .
while the government 's new fairer funding proposals are supposed to help , here in bedfordshire , hertfordshire and buckinghamshire there are winners and losers .

funding will be shared more equally between urban and rural schools , and the national union of teachers ( nut ) says this means luton is set to lose £ 22m a year - that 's the equivalent of 590 teachers .
buckinghamshire on the other hand , which has seven of the 10 lowest funded schools in the country , will receive an extra £ 10m a year .
a department for education spokesman said school funding `` will be over £ 40bn in 2016-17 - its highest level on record '' .

`` we recognise that schools are facing cost pressures , which is why we will continue to provide advice and support to help them use their funding in cost-effective ways , including improving the way they buy goods and services so they get the best possible value for their pupils , '' he said .
author: Nicola Haseler
BBC Three Counties

documents.title: video : bedfordshire road blocked by fly-tipping
text: we told you yesterday about a bedfordshire road that was closed after waste including a toilet , bathtub and fridge had been fly-tipped .
three counties reporter justin dealey went to london lane in houghton conquest earlier , and as you can see from the video below , the waste is still blocking the road .
fly tipping in houghton conquest .
london lane has been closed since sunday
have you spoken to anyone at central beds council why they have n't it up when it 's been reported ?
of course - they have just responded and are sorting it asap shame it took a radio show to get something done
i know you 're right but well done for getting it it sorted
disgusting people .
@ twitterid
there must be some way of tracing who 's done this , it would of needed a fair size truck to do this .
really are some scummy people in this world and beds , herts & bucks seems to have more than its fair share
what is wrong with today 's society ?
it is unbelievable how people 's minds work .
whoever did this has done it before !
two weeks ago exactly the same happened in delmer end lane between redbourn & flamstead !

documents.title: luton borough council to discuss impact of brexit on airport
text: the future of luton airport following the uk 's departure from the european union is being discussed by luton councillors tonight .
a motion put forward by council leader hazel simmons points to the number of people employed by the airport , by airlines easyjet and monarch , and by luton-based travel company tui .
it comes as the supreme court will rule later this morning on whether mps should have a vote before article 50 is triggered .
transport secretary chris grayling says flights to europe from luton wo n't stop because of brexit .
`` nobody seriously thinks that planes are going to stop flying from luton to all part of continental europe , '' he said .
`` there are regions that depend on holidaymakers from the united kingdom . ''
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: video : a foggy day ahead
text: the day begins with freezing temperatures , fog and some frost across the bbc east region .
the fog may persist throughout the day as temperatures do n't rise above 3-5c ( 37-41f ) .
watch my full forecast here :
for a more detailed forecast where you are , visit bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning and welcome back to live updates of news , weather , travel and sport across bedfordshire , hertfordshire and buckinghamshire .
we 'll have the full weather forecast for you shortly but in the meantime you can always get in touch with us via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Sarah Jenkins
